solution_line_template: Marnie has already eaten {initial_chips_eaten} of the chips + {additional_chips_eaten} more = <<{initial_chips_eaten}+{additional_chips_eaten}={chips_eaten_first_day}>>{chips_eaten_first_day} chips Marnie ate.

The bag has {total_chips_in_bag} chips in it and Marnie has only eaten {chips_eaten_first_day}, {total_chips_in_bag} - {chips_eaten_first_day} = <<{total_chips_in_bag}-{chips_eaten_first_day}={remaining_chips_after_first_day}>>{remaining_chips_after_first_day} chips left.

If Marnie eats {chips_eaten_per_day} chips a day starting from the second day she has them, it will take her {remaining_chips_after_first_day} chips in the bag / {chips_eaten_per_day} chips Marine eats a day = <<{remaining_chips_after_first_day}/{chips_eaten_per_day}={days_to_eat_remaining_chips}>>{days_to_eat_remaining_chips} days to eat the whole bag.

However, Marnie also ate chips on the first day she bought them, so {days_to_eat_remaining_chips} + {first_day_count} = <<{days_to_eat_remaining_chips}+{first_day_count}={total_days}>>{total_days} days to eat the whole bag.
